text:
On draft at Disney World Animal Kingdom at the Yak & Yeti. I am not a huge Heify person but this one is pretty descent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.

A- Coriander, wheat.

A- Gold color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Coriander, subtle bubblegum.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, spiced finish.

O- Expected more out of this for being Top 50 in the style. Lots of coriander and spice and a hint of bubblegum. Not much in terms of citrus or banana.

Poured from bottle thanks AirforceHops has a nice golden color with a white head. Aromas of honey grain banana and spices. Taste is yeasty bread honey sweet finish with a slight hint of orange and lemon.

12 oz. bottle thanks to jcwattsrugger. Clear gold with a good amount of retention. High, active carbonation. Mild wheat zest, weak yeast, and citrus.  
Flavors of orange, lemon and a bit of rind. Lively mouthfeel in a light almost watery texture. Real thin borderline watery. Nice spice note in the finish. Not traditional, American yeast strain, not German. It is ok.

At the white lion in st. Augustine. Pours cloudy yellow. Aromas of wheat and bananas. Initial taste of bananas, cloves and yeasty bread with a creamy mouth feel. Perfect on a hot day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
A pretty good hefeweizen. Nice citrus flavors, smooth body. Sweet finish of of orange and yeast.
A truly smooth yet complex experience. papaya and banana and allspice. all backed up hearty wheat, lingering barley on the back of tongue.
Draft pour at Lost & Found. Poured a light orange color with a small white head. Aroma had light ester notes. Banana, wheat. Nice and easy to drink.

12oz bottle thanks to one of the cousins in the barrio. bottled on date is a smudge. Nose is light bubblegum and coriander. sip adds light banana. light-ish body. not what I look for in the style. cardboard-like flavors in the finish.

An excellent hefy. Good body and flavor. Very smooth delivery and palate that follows unpretentiously. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft @ Doubletree PBI. Aroma is a little bubble gum, banana. Slightly cloudy, golden, thin white head with a little lacing. Flavor is mostly bubble gum with a little banana. No clove. Med to full bodied. Overall, a good German Hefe, but I prefer more clove favor personally.

Bottle in Orlando. Pours a hazy orange and makes a thin head. Aroma is of malted wheat, citrus, and spices. Tastes of light hops, wheat, lemon, and some banana. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is my favorite! Im noticing stores are selling out. Are they discontuing the beer or is it just flying off the shelf?

Bottle at cgarvieuk tasting. 
Appearance - cloudy yellow. Nae heid. 
Nose - cooked vegetables and bitter lime. 
Taste - lemon and lime. A bit shandy. 
Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - ok but a bit like shandy.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden, nose is banana, orange, hibiscus, tomato, taste is sweet, herbal, dry, banana.
Several 12 oz. bottles. Disney trip 2017. Poured hazy orange with thin white head. Big wheat, banana esters, orange, notes of clove. As complex a hefe as youll see. Titties for a hefe.
On tap at World Of Beer. Not my favourite style, well made with a hint of banana and bubblegum, not bad at all.
poured from tap several times from many locations in west palm beach very tasty drink all night kind brew.
Expected a lot less based on ratings. Clear orange pour with next to no head. Aroma is grainy with banana and a little citrus. Taste follows nose. Pleasantly surprised.

12 oz bottle. Hazy gold color with a soft quickly dissipating white head. Aromas of oranges, apricots, wheat, and cloves. A bit of banana, citrus bite and tingle, coriander, yeast, and juicy fruit gum. Refreshing and easy drinking.

3 oz pour on draft at the Hiltons Buena Vista Palace lobby bar. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herb, coriander, subtle citrus and banana. Tastes of herb, citrus fruit and peel. Light body with a dry finish.
Fairly pale. Only a slight haze. Not a bad clove and faint banana. Not bad especially in the location.

Clear lemon gold with moderate head and lazy carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel, with banana clove esters then a nice wheat sweetness following. Well balanced for a hefe, which is not usually a style I like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at the brewery. Some haze in the white gold beer. A small white layer of foam. Bubblegum aroma with grain and cloves. Some banana and yeast flavors with bubblegum. Sugary malts. Wheat. Light citrus. Pleasant stuff that is one the sweet side.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Oh my...this is a great Weissbier. Its hazy orange, good carbonation. Theres some bananas, clove, pepper, orange ... Wow. This is close to my favorite hefe Ive ever had. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 BJCP Category: 10A Weissbier
AROMA: Potent Bavarian yeast esters of banana and clove; wheat imparts bready aroma. Some orange sherbet scent in the background. 11/12APPEARANCE: Hazy amber/orange, but translucent. Effervescent carbonation visible. Large, white, froth laces and retains well. 3/3FLAVOR: Moderately strong banana bread flavor throughout (wheat + esters). Clove is prominent as well and imparts a light peppery sensation. Faint orange juice concentrate as it finishes. Hops are used sparingly and complement the natural spicy sensation. Each sip is delicious. 19/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body with a nice viscosity. Mouthfeel is soft, comfortable and smooth. Effervescent but too thick to be crisp like a lager. Aftertaste is mostly clean with minor banana flavor. Very refreshing and easily quaffed. 5/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Probably the best hefeweizen being made in the USA today and better than many German brews of the style. A near perfect beer. 10/10TOTAL SCORE: 48/50DISCLAIMER: The author is not a certified BJCP judge; therefore, this score sheet is not necessarily indicative of proper BJCP judging techniques and protocol. The author is grading to 2015 BJCP Guidelines in order to prepare for examination.
Banana, clove, apricot, moderate spice, Fresh, nice gold with lasting white head. Tasty!

Slightly hazy yellow with a fluffy white head.
Light bready aroma with some banana and clove.
Lightly sweet flavor with a bit of citrus. A bit light but no flaws. 
I would prefer more body also.

Fruity - banana - nose with a little clove. Cloudy, dark golden pour with thick persistent foam. Dry wheat at first quickly gives way to banana and spice. Medium carbonation with slick mouthfeel. Maltiness around the edges and some citrus too. Maybe some yeast on the end. Certainly a sweet example of a wheat beer.

16 oz draft pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of banana, clove, light citrus. Light bodied, refreshing and very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy yellow color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, clove, some bananas, and light spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, and clove/spice; Nicely balanced; Very solid hefe.

Cloudy yellow body with a small wispy white head that faded to a thin film. The nose is fruity with banana and clove, plenty of yeastiness, soft wheat. The flavor is pretty spot on, lots of fruity esters, soft wheat and bready pale malt, lightly spicy lingering finish. Soft and easy drinking with gentle carbonation. Pretty great stuff.
Pours a hazy golden yellow. Aromas of bread/grains/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty grains with some spice and bananas.
Pours hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is earthy, clove, wheat, banana. Taste is soft bitters, light tartness. Soft bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle. Pours bright hazy golden with fluffy white head. Nose and taste is all banana and clove. A little lemon sourness in the backend.

12oz bottle at Rainforest Cafe @ Disney Animal Kingdom 
Pours slightly cloudy golden with a small white head, light lacing. Aroma of banana, cloves and cereal. Flavors of cloves, banana esters and oranges 
Ok, but I was expecting it to be better considering the high overall score.
Banana, bubblegum, spices. Very flavourful and aromatic. This is as good as any traditional hefe Ive had. Very quenching, perfect for Florida.
Keg at the yard house... Hazy amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet banana.. Light clove... Spicy nose... Zezty spice banana fruit.. Juicy fruits.. Over fizzy for sure
Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Wheat, citrus, banana, cloves, and some yeast on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with wheat and spice.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 Its refreshing to see an "American Hefe" thats true to the German style. I dont think there is such thing as an American hefe. Huge thanks to Keven for sharing this. Pours a tang color with a big bubble head. Aroma of orange fruit, wheat and yeast. Drinks juicy, wheat forward, with a cool, yeast finish. What a hefe is supposed to be. Very enjoyable.  UPDATE: retried on draft in Florida.  This beer was meant to be enjoyed in the Florida heat.  Very refreshing, and has some orange and banana juice quality to it.  Im interested in these guys, but I keep running into the same beer!  At least its really good.

Bottle courtesy of GandGKevin. Thanks! Hazy gold pour with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, citrus notes and spice. Taste is banana, wheat, yeast, citrus and spices. Light-medium body with a strong, bubbly carbonation. Finishes with more banana, light bubblegum notes, wheat, yeast, citrus and soft spice.
Heavy on the ripe banana slight hazy appearance with little head. Decent. On tap at ESPN.

Rated on 02-02-2016 (Bottle) The appearance is a small white head that mostly diminished, hazy pale yellow body, fast rising carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is a lot of banana, clove, light tartness, honey, citrus, some lemon, wheat, yeast, and malt. The flavor is citrus, bananas, light tartness, sweet, clove, wheat, yeast, and malt. The mouthfeel is light carbonation and this beer is light bodied. A very quaffable beer with a good flavor and a lot of aromas. It is a beer that I would drink again.

This is a little different than the normal average Hef. Has a semi-clear yellow to light orange appearance. Filtered more so loses some of that yeasty flavor, yet gives it a smoother and crisp feel. Some fruity flavors like mild orange and mango. Also tasting some nuttiness. Id get this again.

Draft. Pours cloudy gold with thin white head and minimal lacing. Orange citrus aroma with coriander notes. Orange citrus and wheat malt with coriander. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 10/27/2015 enjoyed 1/19/2016 in a pint glass.

Look - Little murky. Yellow orange. No head. No lacing.

Smell - Banana. Bread. Wheat. Salt. 

Taste - Banana and wheat. Lighter than most. Light orange and lemon. 

Feel - I hate overly carbonated wheat beers and this is not it. Great feel, sits well, no alcohol. 

Overall - Decent wheat. Lighter on citrus. Not too carbonated.

Pours a hazy amber. Aroma of banana, clove, and maybe some bubble gum? Spicy yeastiness, well-balanced. Very good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at funky buddha lounge, boca raton. Hazy light golden color, white head. Aroma has wheat, banana, citrus. Balanced fresh taste, banana, wheat.

Pours cloudy orange with flat head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, light yeast and honey. Taste is citrus and orange, light sweet but also crisp and fresh. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation. A different but highly drinkable hefeweizen.

Bottle (Oct 14, 2015 bottling). Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly/fully diminishing. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), with notes of banana, spoiled orange juice, clove. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter, unclean. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. 
Another pour showing from FB, and once again an infection is evident. More sour than the IPA and with the same spoiled OJ note. A highly unpleasant drain pour.
Not the best I've ever had but definitely a smooth hefeweizen. A little bit of banana flavored but not too strong.

Sampled at GABF 2015 with Moreau and Paul. Pours a lightly hazy golden body with thick white lacing. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with fresh wheat and gentle citrus fruits. Some soft lemon. Though plain, one thing great about this Hefeweizen is that there is little to no banana/clove aspect.
Solid hefe. Nice bright hazy golden. Clove, orange, bubblegum, mildly tart. Medium mouthfeel for the style. Great stuff for the style.

Draft at lobster pot Sarasota siesta key. Gold. Aroma was yeasty banana with citrus. The taste follows and paired perfectly with garlic, lemon-butter with shellfish and pasta. Not my favorite style but, excellent with this meal and setting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Brewpub. Pours a small white head and hazy yellow color. Aroma is sweet light bananas, cloves, and orange. As it warms more banana. Taste is sweet light watery malt, tart, cloves, and orange. Palate is soft effervescence and mellow but watery. I am very critical of southern style German beers. A surprising and great attempt from Florida at this German Classic

Cloudy yellow-golden pour with a tall, foamy, white head. Lemon, banana, and clove nose. Healthy mouthfeel. Flavors follow the nose pretty faithfully. Some sweet bubble gum and cotton candy remains on the palate after the finish.
Bottle, thanks to cards04. Cloudy pale yellow pour with a healthy white head. Not very sweet, some banana and lemon zest. Quite mild but not bad.
Thanks Cards! CLoudy orange golden, hefe yeast aroma, clove, banana, for some reason i was expecting there to be oranges in here. Overall a pretty decent but rather ordinary hefe.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2015 Pours a hazy golden color with a white head. Nice lacing in the glass. Aromas of tart citrus. Taste the same very tart on the tongue. Nice hefe flavors.

Hazy golden yellow pour with thin dissipating head. Hefe yeast, banana, clove, and wheat are all there. A bit of a zing with a tart citrus element, which is enjoyable. One of the best tasting hefeweizens Ive ever had. Not much to look at, but overall very good.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy golden yellow color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate citrus, clove, banana aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium spice sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

12oz. bottle, Im not a huge fan of the style, but of the ones Ive tried, this one stands out. Taste is a bit citrusy and there is a bit of a bite on the back end which is typical of a lot of Funky Buddha beers that Ive had. Recommended.

September 1, 2015 - bottle from Knightly. Partially cloudy yellow pour with nice amount of head that faded quickly. Aroma was very strong banana with some citrus and spice. Taste was nicely balanced between the flavors in the aroma. One of the better beers I have had in this style.

Thanks cards04 for the bottle. Its been a while since I rated a hefeweizen. Cloudy orange yellow body, not much head, retention or lacing. Lactose, yeast, a kind of tart funk on the nose. Taste is fairly sweet but theres also a tart citrus element as well. I get less banana in this than some other hefeweizens. Okay.

Pours a hazy golden. Aromas are sweet bread, clove, and some banana. Typical hefeweizen stuff. Yeasty flavours. Definitely getting citrus in this. I guess thats what makes this Floridian. Tasty, well rounded brew.

12 oz. bottle from Homer321- thanks again, LouSean! Pours a cloudy goldenrod color with a small off-white head that leaves an uneven ring and wispy film behind. Notes of banana, wheat, very faint clove, citrus fruits, pineapple, and peach. Light-bodied, with a dry, fruity, estery mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Pretty straightforward and easy drinking.

Bottle. Pours orange with a very slight murkiness. Smell of wheat and banana over medium carbonation. Some spice, some vanilla, mild heat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at World of Beer. Hazy yellow color with a fluffy white head. This is really well done -- the right amount of sweetness, spice, and a touch of tartness that really works. I drank a couple of glasses with ease and could have kept going for a while. Theres banana flavor, light citrus, a solid wheat malt foundation, and complimented by spicy cloves. I really like how none of this is overdone but the finished product isnt short on flavor. Theres actually some body to this too -- slick, refreshing, and tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Bottle. Strong banana aroma. Flavors comprise banana plus citrus. Pleasant and easy to drink. Slight tang.
2nd time: Banana not near as strong in draft version. More fruity than remember

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle, thanks to homer321. This is a solid German Hefeweizen. Banana, clove, very much a yeast driven beer. The malts are doughy, there is a slight tartness that makes this very refreshing.

Bouteille.
Trouble orangée, col fin blanc.Arôme dester fruité, pointe dépice et léger houblonné.
Palais est légèrement fruité, ester et muscade avec une pointe épicée rappelant la coriandre. Impression plus orangée en ressort. Effervescence est moyenne-haute et crisp, fleuri avec une pointe herbacée pour les houblons qui restent dans une approche noble.
Bottle. Orange, banana, clove and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy pale yellow with moderate head. Sweet banana, lemon, clove, and wheat malt flavor. Body on the light side. Pretty good.

Draft at Engine Rose. Very hazy, bright orange pour. Banana, wheat, yeast aroma. More of a citrus flavor, with wheat and a little dough in the background. Very light with little carbonation - mouthfeel is almost like a flat cider. Pretty standard for the style, but damn refreshing on a 95 degree day in Florida.

Bottle:
Pours hazed, light yellow-gold with a white head.
Lemon, banana, slightly sour wheat malt aroma.
Lemon/citrus, banana, wheat malt taste.
A bit tangy and yeasty.
Pretty good.
Bottle. Hazy bright yellow with small off-white head, sweetish citrus aroma, high carbonation, citrus taste, longish citrus peel finish. Very nice and balanced hefeweizen.
Bright Orange, slightly hazy, with a big white head. Smells fruity, some banana, some crackery malty notes. Taste is banana, lemon, and toasty. Nice yeasty flavors, too.

Bottle poured a hazy golden amber with a small lingering ivory head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, citrus, love and light bubblegum. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, clove, light citrus and light banana with a smooth dry finish.

Bottle poured a dark golden color with a thick one finger head that retained well. Aroma has big banana, wheat, mild sweetness, and lots of yeasty character. Mouth feel is light with low side carbonation. Flavor again is all about the yeast, banana, flowery, wheat, and very easy drinking.

12 onz shared with seb and Alex A: ripped banana, bubblegum, cloves, wheat app: hazy pale minimal white head some lacing t/p: med body with light acidic finish. Moderate carbonation. O: great. Particularly like the nose big and bold. Can only imagine myself drinking this poolside.

Bottle shared with Jo and Seb. Thanks Seb. Aroma: ripped banana, citrus, cloves, earthy a bit. App: hazy pale with small white head and some lacing. Taste and palate: light to medium body, light sweetness, light dry acidity finish. Overall: a good hefeweizen, maybe a tad too try for the style but still enjoyed it.

Bottle split at the midnight hot tub tasting thanks to 47574, 22/04/15.
Hazed orange with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is tangy orange, yeast, clove, Mandarin, light spice.
Taste comprises orange peeled caramel, light spice, straw, tangerine, clove.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light hop dusting.. 
Solid hefe, juicy orange, never gets dull.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
330ml bottle share with Theydon Bois, bottle broguth back from USA trip.
Orange hazy pour with white fizzy head, notes of wheat, banana, light malt. A good Hefeweizen representation.
Great Hefeweizen , full of banana yeast flavour, with a clean finish. Very easy to drink

12oz bottle. No code date. Appearance: light golden with only a slight cloudiness. Not much yeast residing in the bottom of the bottle. 
Aroma: Smells distinctly like a Belgian yeast, not German.  Clove dominates, with apple and pear prominent. Banana is there but faint. 
Taste: Yeast starts to shine on the tongue. Banana and clove dominate, with an abnormally sweet malt and fruity backbone. Almost cloyingly sweet, with citrus/orange coming thru. 
Mouthfeel: Light to medium body, thin for the style, and lighter carbonation than typical for style. 
Finish: Really sweet citrusy malt lingers, with no hop character to balance and little carbonic bite. 
Overall: Far from a great example of the style. Cloyingly sweet, light body and carbonation for the style, and the aroma is much more phenolic than estery. Still a refreshing beer, but could be cleaned up.

Draft. Cloudy burnt orange with a short white head. Aroma shows browned banana and clove esters and phenols of weizen yeast with muddled wheat and over-kilned caramel-heavy malt (burnt pancakes). Bubble gum fruitiness becomes overblown as it warms, and the yeast seems more doughy and raw. Its medium bodied and sweet with low bitterness and medium acidity, wheat is slick and the malt is syrupy while the carbonation is brash. Pretty basic and rough hefeweizen.
Draft. Orange hazy pour with white head. Light wheat, fruit aromas. Flavors are light wheat, fruit and yeast like tones.
Pours hazy orangish golden color with white head. Aromas of banana, cloves, oranges, and wheat. Similar flavors. Medium body with lively carbonation. Refreshing on a hot day.
Bottle at the Boca Raton Resort, FL in early March. A very sweet and fruity Hefeweizen. Sort of a Floridian influence on the German classic.   Creative but not an improvement.

Hazy orange color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, banana, citrus, and clove. Taste of a nice hefe, banana, light clove, and some citrus and medium happiness in the finish.
Bottle. Big-time banana medicine and vanilla aroma. Dry lemon and banana taste. Dry finish. Good heffy.
Tap. Lightly hazy golden with one finger head. Light banana. Strong wheat with some lemon. Would like some more spice/clove.

Murky gold color with a lasting white head. Traditional Bavarian hefe nose with banana, clove and a bit of bubblegum. This is a nice, refreshing beer with a bit of fruitiness with the banana and clove spiciness.

Appearance: Light orange, quite hazy. Some fizzle off-white head.
Aroma: Wheat, lemon.
Taste: Wheat, lemon, light fruits. Nice and smooth.
Bought: Gift from Nipun J - thanks!, 355 ml
Info: 21/2-2015
Bottle at Shades of Green. First Funky Buddha beer and it was tasty. This was a true to form German hefe. Lots of yeast, clove and banana. Nice.
Draft - Light tart wheat. Cloudy yellow with a white rich head. Sweet and tart with a bit of lemon. OK.
Draft. Pours hazy orange gold with a white head. Fruity yeasty base, with banana, citrus, light spicy notes, wheat, and some light bubblegummy sweetness in the finish. Pretty dope.
Extra in a recent trade. Smooth palate with some clove and spice. Little bit of banana. Can imagine this is pretty refreshing in a hot Florida sunmer. Id like another for a July weekend in Atlanta.
Pours slightly cloudy. Clove and grass flavors. Not much banana. Very smooth palette.

Draught as part of a flight at the Funky Buddha Brewery in Oakland Park on January 21, 2015.Marked 5.6% ABV.Clear straw yellow color, white head. Phenolic, banana estery taste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Estery phenolic aftertaste. Estery, phenolic, some sulphur scent.

Bottle purchased at total wine in ft Lauderdale fl
pours deep hazy orange with a soapy fluffy eggshell head and sparse lacing. Nose is huge banana clove bubblegum and some grassy notes. Flavors are very big banana but a tad more tart than I was expecting. Excellent hefe!

Aroma: Bubble Gum, Oranges, Wheat

Appearance: Hazy Orange, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Decent Lacing

Taste: Wheat, Mild Orange, Mild Yeast

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet
Tap at Tomoka. Slightly hazy pale orange pour with a small white ring head. Clove and banana, light palate, slightly dry finish.
Bottle pours hazy orange, aroma is light bread, citrus, and yeast spice. Taste is light spice and crisp citrus with a nice fruity finish, nice beer

Great beer! Taste floral and a wonderful wheat beer, a different take on the german classic, very refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Definitely doesnt taste German but very obviously at wheat beer. A bit tart but very sessionable.

On tap at First Magnitude. Hazy yellow pour with a small creamy white head. Aroma of banana esters, yeasty, wheat malts. Yup, its a hefe. Nice smooth flavor with banana esters, yeasties, some clove or coriander. Light bodied but robust flavor, high carbonation. A really nice hefe.

Citrus dominant hefeweizen more in the vein of a Wheat Ale than a true german Hefeweizen but its kinda sorta a little estery so I guess thats why it goes in this category. Pretty good but lacks the punch of an 80 acre or the authenticity of a Victory hefeweizen.
Very nice but not so special. Had it in a beer celebration and was nice to drink. Quite tart and floral.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Re rated. Awesome German hefe. One of the best American versions Ive had in awhile. 

Sampled at GABF 2014. Pours a Hazy golden color with white head. Fruity, yeast, bananas flavors. 8/4/7/4/15

On tap at Lokal Miami. Pours a hazed orange with a wispy head. Light hefe aromas of dough yeast lemon banana. Medium to light carbonation with a medium bodied mouth feel. Lots of earthy malt banana with a dry finish.

Murky yellow beer with a frothy, white head. Aromas of tropical fruit and wheat. Tastes of bananas, oranges, and slight pineapple notes. Very citric with a nice, fresh wheat balance to the flavors. Sweet, semi-tart, fruit finish. Refreshing, tasty, but a tad forgettable.

4oz pour at Churchkey DC pours a murky, dandelion gold with some creamy white head. Nose is fruity, tropical fruit, pear, mildly grassy, a little talcum. Flavor is sweet, a little buttery, mild biscuit, mild grass, a little floral. Creamy finish. Decent.

Pours cloudy golden with ok head and lacing. Not sure I like the helles addition to this. Finishes with light sweetness, light sourness. Some light banana and some bread yeast. Tap at Churchkey shared by Travlr, thanks!
Draft at Churchkey. Cloudy pale yellow color. Aroma of white pepper, dusty lemon. Taste is citrus, light spice, subtle banana. Easy drinking.

Typical cloudy appearance but not as strong of a banana/clove/bubblegum scent or flavor as found in a Bavarian style hefe. I guess that is what makes it a FL style; more citrusy. This could be good or bad depending which style you prefer. Quality/flavor was consistent amongst the actual brewery draft and retail taps.
On tap. Hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma is of wheat and fruity. Wheat flavor with fruitiness and also some orange. Light bodied. Pretty good.
Pours a cloudy light orange. Notes of citrus, banana and a hint of clove. Somewhat sweet. A quality hefe, but nothing earth shattering
Draught at MikkellerBar. Cloudy golden - white head. Sweetness. Tangerine. Light fatness. Wheaty. Citrus. Light bitterness. Grass notes. Rather spicy. Cinnamon.
Hazy gold, white head, banana, citrus and clove. Shocking for a hefe! But why mess with what works?

On tap at the Churchville Inn. Hazy orange brown with scant froth. Nose is wheat and faint citrus. Medium light with a tang. Taste is wheaty banana, clove and orange zest. Mostly a straight up hefe; just OK.
From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small to fully gone head. Aroma is bubblegum and light fruity. Bitter, orange fruity and estery. Bitter and dry herbal finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. 
Hazy amber coloured with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of spices and citrus.
Fruity flavour of citrus peel and bubble gum.
Citric finish.
Very nice hefey. Aims of cloves and some banana. Typical appearance of a true Hefeweizen. Tasted very good, tastes of banana and cloves. Very solid.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of banana, wheat, and cloves. The flavor is sweet with notes of peaches, banana, cloves, and wheat, leading to bitter finish.
On tap. Nose of bananas. Taste follows with mellow, dry finish. Not a big fan of wheats but this was good.

On tap, Parlay Sports Bar, with LuckyDog. Muddy appearance, musty wheat, odd fruits and spiciness. A bit spritzier than a lot of hefes that Ive had. Will need to resample, didnt take notes, but I wasnt really impressed.
On tap at the brewery. Comes a cloudy pale gold with an average white head. Aroma of citrus, spice, and grass. Taste is citrus, banana, spice, grain, and grass. Easy to drink.
Have had this more than once - think my note is from tap at Proof: hazy yellow pour. aroma of clove, lemon, banana. tastes are yeast, orange, lemon. little watery. not for me. 6.2

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 On tap at the Brewpub. Pours a small white head and hazy yellow color. Aroma is sweet light bananas, cloves, and orange. As it warms more banana. Taste is sweet light watery malt, tart, cloves, and orange. Palate is soft effervescence and mellow but watery. I am very critical of southern style German beers. A surprising and great attempt from Florida at this German Classic
Swirly lace and head above the cloudy body. Solid aroma of wheaty grains, coriander, banana, bubblegum. Pretty well balanced, good body, tasty overall.

1/17/14. Shared by a kind soul at Proof. Hazy yellow orange pour with a mild off-white head. Somewhat plain aroma and flavor - mild banana, spice, cream, and pale malts. Appropriate but bland. Not bad.

Tap at Proof. Slightly hazy tan-orange with off white head, medium-thick collar. Aroma is really citrusy, I get some plenty of wheat-like grains, and some berry. Light in body, low carbonation. Thin mouthfeel, this beer fades quickly from my palate. Taste is pretty much exactly like the aroma.

Pours cloudy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is clove with a tinge of citrus. Taste is nice for a wheat - clove all day, then a beautiful toasty malt comes in the mid palate. A lite bitterness runs throughout with a finish that just fades out to oblivion - kinda like the one drinking it.

Draft at the Funky Buddha Lounge. Snifter. Pours a golden light orange with lots of haze. Thick fluffy white head. Aroma of cloves, bananas, orange, hay, grass and cereal. The taste is similar with the full spices coming through. A little acidic. Light body, medium carbonation. Crisp finish.

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque gold with a thin, fizzy white head and some lacing. Tastes like sweet bubblegum and wheat, light musk and lemon. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like grains, citrus, musk.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy gold with creamy white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, orange peel, cereal and cookie malts, floral notes, and light lavender. Flavor is dry malts with some light fruit sweetness, light butterscotch, faint floral hops, and faint herbs; dry finish. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

Draft at Proof. Cloudy golden pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma is the usual suspects of a Hefe yet very well balanced, not cloying banana with a splash of citrus in the mix. Flavor is similar and spritzy with a clean snappy finish. Not bad.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow on tap with dissipating white head. Aroma is typical hefe esters from the yeast, but a little lighter on the wheat and fruitier. Taste follows, definitely more of the fruit than the bread or spice, slight bubblegum. Not bad, not to style really, but definitely nice change and good for Florida heat.

Tallahassee, Fl - Proof Brewing Co. - on tap. Hazy dark yellow pour, little to no head. Aroma has some light bubble gun notes, not much else. Falvor is dull with some overripe fruit accents. some sweet apricot-like sweetness, just a hint of coriander. Mouthfeel is thick enough. Not very hefe-like.

Aroma of Belgian yeast and hints of banana and clove. Pours a hazy yellow-orange with a, mostly diminishing, white head and no lacing. The taste is citrus, yeast, and cloves. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Overall, an enjoyable Hefewiezen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une robe jaune passablement voilée. Une tête blanche faite de grosses bulles. Un nez de blé grillé, de banane verte et de miel. Rien de bien impressionnant pour mes narines. Une bouche fruitée avec des oranges et de la banane. Des épices à ne pas confondre avec le blé. Sans aucun doute, des notes douches à travers des houblons en herbes. Au palais, un corps de faible densité avec un pétillement trop élevé. Une texture qui en souffre. Une finale amèrement épicée qui est beaucoup trop courte. Cette bière est-elle ordinaire ou cest moi qui aime de moins en moins le style?

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2014 Funky Buddha Floridian is not a bad Hefeweizen, but not what you would expect after having the typical German variety. Moderate fresh, fruity aroma. Taste is mostly lemon with few banana and clove notes that you might expect. Lemony on the palate as well. Floridian is good in its own right but not necessarily true to the style.

Cloudy golden colored pour. Bordering on yellow. Big white head that manages not to stick around for any long amount of time. Plenty of lacing. Slight aroma of banana and clove. Earthy. Taste is a little bubblegum and yeast. Not bad.

Tap at Charlie Macs. Hazy gold pour with a thick white head. Smooth wheat body with citrus notes. Light citrus notes in aroma. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at GABF. Pour is slightly hazy orange in appearance with a small white head and good lacing. Big banana, citrusy, clove, some light bubblegum, herbs, dough, and bready aroma. Taste is banana, bubblegum, wheaty, fresh cut grass, basil, and bread with a hint of clove on the back-end. Medium body with medium-to-high carbonation. Pretty good stuff.

Refrigerated growler from hopscotch. Pours beautiful hazy light orange with yellow highlights with medium bright white head. Aroma is nice honey/clove, medium body, medium/well carbonated, and some thin big bubble lacing. Taste honey, orange, clove, some grainyness and some banana. Big plus on the honey small minus on the grainyness. Pretty good hefe, thank you hopscotch.

Tap at the brewery. Pouts cloudy yellow, minimal head. Strong vanilla in nose and flavor. Minimal clove. A mightily slick on the tongue. Full mouthfeel. Refreshing and not overly carbonated like the German born hefes. 

---Rated via intercellular device

A weak grainy hefe. Does not have as much banana as often in many this style but mouthfeel is watery. Below average for style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really nice example of the style, small head but loads of bananas and clove in the aroma. A bit fizzy but refreshing and full bodied considering the style
Amazing hefeweizen with a great drinkable quality during any time of year. I love it with white fish and chicken dishes or when snacking on some peanuts. My go to after work beer.

Draft at brewery taproom. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Leaves lacing in the glass. Has a nice banana nose on it. Big burst of banana and estery flavor on the tongue. The first few swallows almost exploded in my mouth. Finish lingers a bit. Very nice, perhaps the best hefe Ive had outside of Pennsylvania.

A very standard wheat.  Good banana and light apricot.  Very light tasting and opaque.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4 oz sampler draft at the brewpub in Boca Raton, Florida.  The pour is a hazed yellow, with a smallish white head.  The aroma is clove yeast, fresh natural wheat, a bit of bubblegum.  The taste is a nice blend of wheat, clove yeast, lemon citric and only a hint of the bubblegum.  The palate is light to medium bodied, nice unfiltered mouth feel, and a crisp citrus finish.  Nice.
Bottle. Pours apricot gold with white head. Nose and taste of pureed banana with peel, honey, florals, wheat malt, orange peel, orange blossom and light clove. Medium body.

Cloudy golden orange pour with a white head. Really nice banana and clove aromas. A slight citric tartness of orange and lemon. Lots of bread and a good malt sweetness. Theres plenty of banana and clove to the flavor, too. Works well with the sweet bready malt and a subtle citrus note. Nice yeast bite on the finish, too.
12 oz poured into tulip. Hazy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is cloves and honey. Taste is tart and crisp with a dry finish. Pretty good hefe.
Bottle thanks Dave. Pours light yellow big head. Banana aroma. Taste is crisp refreshing hefe

On tap at Monks, pours a glowing golden orange color, nice bright white head medium in size but not lasting. Not enough lace to note. Aromas and taste of sugary honey, kolsch flavors, not ultra yeasty, peppermint, cloves, and some other belgian spice. Thought it would be dryer but it wasnt. Not my style at all. Refreshing though.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a yellow golden with surprisingly little head. Nice wild tropical aroma. Mouthfeel is pretty light for a hefe with little carbonation. Doesn't have that wheat heft to it. Fast is very floral, like drinking a lager with bubblegum and passion fruit juice mixed in. Overall a different take on a hefe but very good flavor. If they could get this like a normal hefe but with the same flavor, it would be world class. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at the brewery, hazy golden pour with tropical fruit nose.  Tastes of orange blossom, banana, malt, spices, sour wheat, yeast, and vanilla.  Lively body and refreshing at 130am on a Monday night
On tap at Funky Buddha. Pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aromas of clove, orange, lemon, banana, and clove. Flavors of wheat, clove, yeast, orange, and lemon. Nice mouthfeel. Solid hefe.

Keg.
Bananas and cloves, lemon zest with a stronger tartness than typical for hefeweizens, citrus fruits. Incredibly refreshing. Thrilled this is rumored to be Funky Buddhas staple beer when they start bottling.

Tap at Funky Buddha. It pours clear golden yellow, with a fizzy white head. The nose is green banana on the verge of turning yellow, wheat, honey and some spice. The taste is banana (on the green side), subtle tartness, orange, wheat, dough and touch of spice, with a dry, slightly tart finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and soft mouth-feel. Great balance. I didnt expect to like this, but was pleasantly surprised.
Hazy dull straw.  Thin head.  Smells like sweet, sweet bubblegum.  Very sweet and cloying, not at all what I want in a hefeweizen.  The wheat character is muted.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/22/2011.  Poured from a 32 oz. growler into a tulip.

My pour is a hazy straw color with a bubbly off-white head. Not much retention or lace, but I expect that out of a growler.

Less of a sweet aroma than I would expect out of a Hefe. Some honey, banana, and light malt notes. A little white grape skin and green apple, maybe from another yeast strain?

The flavor is soft, nuanced, and balanced. There is a soft pale malt front with some honey, banana, and clove, but a white grape and green apple adds some tartness toward the end. 

This is light and dry compared to the normal example of the style. It feels like they have added a yeast to dry it out further than usual. The carbonation is crisp and contributes to the dryness. 

I enjoyed this take on the style. Balanced and a little different.

Tap at Hunahpu 2012. A nice surprise with this one. Nose is fair amounts of yeast and lemon zest, with some light wheat and clove. This one looked yellow and cloudy with a white head. The light mouthfeel and bright citrus notes made this a good palate changer on H day. Bright citrus and spice with a slight zing to the finish. Good stuff.

Deaft @ Funky Buddha. Pours pale hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is yeasty fruity wheaty spicy and a bit sweet. Flavor is fresh fruity sourish yeasty wheaty cloves sweet apples and a bit bitter. Finishes fruity and wheaty with a light bitter touch.
Pours slightly cloudy gold. Aroma is yeast, malt, and spices. Flavor is spices, yeast, and fruit.Medium body. A nice one.

Growler thx to maltzilla, @ Jews brews bbqs. Hazy dark yellow. Aroma has an unfortunate amount of bubblegum. The malts are nice and nutty but the beer comes across as being very unrefined and needs a lot of work. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught.  Hazy yellow body with a thick, frothy, lasting head.  Fair amount of clove in the nose, some peach, and some yucky rubber tire.  Big phenol spiciness upon the first sip.  Clove and black pepper followed by banana and dusty wheat.  Light body, effervescent carbonation.  Dry, fairly clean finish, but the rubber is still there.  Lingering doughy yeast.  Overall a decent  beer, but the rubber tire component detracts.

Poured hazy yellowish orange with white head, big thanks to Doodler, aroma has notes of orange, honey, nice biscuit, clove, banana and bready notes.  Taste is really nice orange, biscuit, lemon, clove, banana notes hints of tart lemon and fruit finishing nice and tart, bitter and dry. Really nice stuff!

Growler @ Dans house. Somewhat cloudy, yellow orange appearance with a nice white head. Really delicious, slightly bready yeasty, weird spicy, lemon citrusy, light banana aroma. Tangy, slightly bready, lemon, orange, light banana, wheat malty flavor. Cool beer! Thanks Scott!!
Sampler at bar, Big orange flavors, not smooth or suave like I would like my hefeweizens. A little sloppy for the style.

Draft at Funky Buddha.  Looks filtered to me, which is odd for a Hefe.  Orange-yellow with a small, foamy white head.  Really clean and well done, fresh and zesty.  Orange banana and a nice balancing clove bite.  The adjuncts really give it some depth and flavor, but it remains a highly sessionable medium bodied beer.  Loses a few points for not really being true to style, but gains them right back for being tasty.
Cloudy yellow pour. Big white head. Light wheat aroma, tart lemony notes. Flavor is wheat, lightly sour. Good stuff.
(Growler from maltzilla). Pours cloudy yellow with nice chunky white head. Aroma has  some tartness, clove, taste is sweet. Medium bodied with oily texture. dry finish.   Pretty good stuff.

Had this yesterday at the brewpub. Review from notes. Received in a hefe glass.

3.5 A: Dark hazed yellow color. One quarter inch white, frothy head.

4.0 S: Clove heavy. Banana underneath with a good spiciness overall. Neutral wheat. Pleasant.

4.0 T: More banana than clove in the taste. Good spiciness with neutral wheat. Light yeastiness and clean overall.

3.5 M: Medium body. Good carbonation for the style. Reasonably creamy.

4.0 D: Solid hefe. Good all around.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 07-06-2011 21:05:41

Draught, hazy yellow with a bright creamy white head.  Nose a little lemon cleaner, taste is super heavy clove with strong perceived sweetness.  Some rubbery, bendable yeast issues.  Too flamboyantly sweet and phenolic for me.

Growler.  Aroma is full of bready malts and fruit; lemon and orange, some nice weizen yeast phenolics, slight sweetness.  Pours a very cloudy golden color with a hint of orange, almost milkshake appearance.  Tastes fantastic; lots of citrus fruit, very yeasty and bready, oranges and lemons, slightly tart in the finish, very refreshing.  Medium-full body on this one, thicker than expected but it works really well, smooth and creamy on the palate.  Plenty of to-style weizen characteristics plus a great dose of creativity; a great brew.
Draft at brewer. Hazy yellow with a white head. Scent of banana and sugar. Taste is sweet malts and citrus.

Wow, had on draft at the Buddha, and was this good.  It looked light refreshing, and just looking at it quench my thirst, and made me wanting more.  A nice hazy hellow that was crisp, can taste a hint of orange and honey.

Growler shared with Rustyham. Pours a hazy gold with a dissipating white head. Typical ester aroma, but with some vanilla and orange blossom. Lighter side of medium bodied with a nice refreshing mouthfeel. This tastes like a fresh, authentic Bavarian hefeweizen, but with accents of honey and vanilla that are not overdone. This beer kicks ass, and I dont say that about many Hefeweizens.
Aroma of golden wheat, cereal. Flavor is a really creamy and crisp, like an orange creamsicle. Refreshing, nottoo filling. Definitely a good beer to drink on a hot summer day
32 ounce growler from the Funky Buddha in Boca Raton, FL for $9.00 Very good.

on tap-pours a white head and hazy yellow color.  Aroma is sweet light malt, rock candy, clove, orange.  As it warms-banana.  Taste is sweet light malt, rock candy, clove, orange.  As it warms-banana.  Soft effervescence.

Had on tap at the Grand Opening of the new Funky Buddha Location, and revisited the beer last night at the grand opening of the Funky Buddha Brewery. They now have the ability to sell growlers too! 

This is a straight forward Hef, but has some crazy yeast notes that push the beer over the top in the categories of aroma and taste. Tons of fruit flavors dance on the tongue with this beer. The body is solid and is carbonated just right for the style. 

An easy session-able beer, and one perfect for Florida.

Thanks to Casey for this... pours a light murky straw, good lacing... light nose of honey and wheat a bit of banana, nice... the taste is a light wit beer with honey and a light vanilla finish, subtle notes but nice... worth having to start your day
Enjoyed a pint at the brewery on May 31st. Bold, inviting nose of banana, a light wheat backing  and a kiss of hops. Gentle sweetness. Highly quaffable.

Handbottle via Electrobunny!  Thx!  Clear gold pour with a frothy egg shell colored head.  Probably more of a kristelweizen but who the hell cares?  Aroma is dominated by grassy hops and ripe banana.  Flavor is crisp and light.  Clean and refreshing.  Bubble gum, banana runts and lemon grass.  decent stab at a style ive grown to despise.  Thanks to my former employer and their yeast bomb of a hefe.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2011 Sampled at Redlight Redlight courtesy of the Orlando ratebeer crew; January 2011
The beer pours from the growler with a hazy gold hue and is topped by a thin, white ring of a head.  The nose of this beer has a funky, autolized yeast character to it as well as a touch of citrus.  The yeasty quality in the aroma is quite distinct and does a really thorough job of drowning out most of the Hefeweizen character that might otherwise be here.

The flavor has the characteristic character of a Hefeweizen, but a touch more yeasty tasting.  It has a light citrus character to it up front and the finish is very rich with vanilla notes.  The vanilla gives this beer a creamy texture despite the beer being fairly light bodied; this would be excessively quaffable if the ample vanilla character didnt seem quite so rich.  The autolized yeast character from the aroma is non-existent in the flavor (perhaps the vanilla notes drown it out, which would certainly be a good thing).  I am not quite to sure what to think of the citrus and vanilla additions to this beer, it certainly takes this Hefewiezen in an interesting direction, the vanilla especially is quite distinctive; still I think they hit the mark with what they were aiming for, but I almost wish this was just a solid version of a German Hefeweizen.

This is one badass hefe!  Holy hell!  I could drink this by the half-barrel.  Pours hazy straw yellow with a nice white head.  Nose is orange, orange, peel, berry, honey, vanilla, and ripe banana.  Flavor has the malt/ wheat presence of a hefe, the sweetness of a witbier, and the vanilla presence that blends the whole thing together.  I must say that this style is usually one and done for me, but I had to have three glasses of this beer.  Thoroughly enjoyable, very balanced, and incredibly Floridian.

Tap pour sampled outside the brewpub adjacent to the parking lot and amid lots of hip too cool for school cigarette smokers. It poured up opaque pale dull gold with thin white head. The aroma has an inviting level of wheat and then moving into a bit of banana and then followed by grainy malts, more banana and faint yeastiness. The taste is bold with thick smooth wheat, mild yeasty spices and growing banana. I get a dash of lemon showing up here and there too. Theres also a pleasing smooth cream soda or vanilla like note in the background that pulls this thing together and allows the experience to achieve flavor harmony despite the acrid smoky surroundings here. This beer leaves me wanting more. I didnt think I would get this into a hefe. Im pretty sure this is the best one Ive had to date. The thin slick sweet background of vanilla works perfectly here. Well done!

Appearance: hazy plucked husked and ready to be mulled grains. White collar leaves large chunks of foam wherever she touches. Swirls lovely.

Nose: gently soured wheat; sour dough. Lemon and orange cream; creamsicles. Pureed bananas and green plantains to add a zip to the sour dough.

Palate: smooth and creamy. Bananas all around with cream in the middle for a quaff, banana cream, another quaff, bananas and cream. Green plantains and banana skins. Spice tickles in the back with a soft dryness underneath to induce thirst. Lemon and orange are an estery presence, melting into and about the creamy doughy bready profile bordered by greenness.

Final Thoughts: wow and wow. An excellent American hybrid hefeweizen, and best of all shes brewed right here in my home state of Florida. A summer sunshine brew if I ever did taste one. Good show!

Tap. Moderate malt note of cookie and cereal, light perfume for the hops and dough for the yeast, with a hint of banana and a big dose of vanilla. Head is small, frothy, white with some spotty lacing and is almost fully diminishing. Color is hazy light amber. Flavor is moderately sweet and lightly acidic to start, then finishes moderately bittersweet. Palate is medium, slick with a lively carbonation. An interesting German Hefeweizen, but a little too pastry-like from the addition of the vanilla.

A blonde hefeweizen with a thin white head. A chalky banana aroma with light honey and rubber. In mouth, a sweet honey banana with loads of vanilla, a bit cloying. Bottle shared with Orlando crew, Jan. 6 2011.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 My Bottom Line:
Citrusy connotations dwell within banana purée and biscuity cloves in this sweetish Weizen.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A thick ring of foam circles the cloudy pale yellow.
-The overt sweetness and medium carbonation take away from the drinkability.
-Vanilla is not that obvious as it is surrounded by honeyed bananas and cereal sweetness.
-The glasses I had in February 2013 and July 2015 showed significant improvement from the one I first had in 2011.br />

On tap at the brewpub and at Kush.

Growler... Hazy, light yellow ale with a small, creamy, white, brief head. The bouquet is very nice and  certainly unique  Dreamsicle with a moderate pinch of  clove. Medium-bodied with a buttery mouthfeel and jazzy carbonation. Sweet, fruity flavor  orange crème and subtle, unobtrusive clove. Crisp, sweet, fruity finish. Two hefeweizens that I really like (Maui Pineapple Hefeweizen) only five days apart? I would have previously thought that impossible. Kudos to the boys at Funky Buddha. Growler courtesy of hankchinaski!

Side note: Nothing screams "FLORIDA" like Madagascar vanilla beans.
Hazy yellow orange.  Bannana, clove, tangarine with a hint of sweet vannila.  Light bodied with fizzy carbonation.  I taste mostly orange with hints of passionfruit and vannila.  Nice, easy drinker.

For a hefe this one really rocks. The color is a murky orange with a thin off white foam head. The aroma is almost like a combo of orange/banana/strawberry. A lot of yeast in there as well. A very well brewed beer.

Nice nose of clove and banana notes, nice orange peel as well as some vanilla and wheaty undertones too. Pours hazy golden yellow, unfiltered with a creamy head. The flavor starts lightly sweet and fruity with notes of banana and clove, vanilla, followed by orange peels and skin flavors with a hint of bitterness as well. Wheaty notes come through and some light sweet fruity notes linger. Quenching and sweet, but dry and unique. Enjoyable.

Big thanks to Kevin for letting me try this one early. Holy man this rocks. What a killer hefe. And whats amazing is he told me they didnt even use a weizen yeast strain on this batch. Pours a cloudy straw yellow as a hefe should pour. Nose is a fantastic melange of orange, big vanilla notes and banana/clove hints. Nice wheaty hit up front with orange peel popping up here and there and finishes with a really awesome hint of creamy vanilla and clove. Really well done.
